metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3842 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In systemd before v242-rc4, it was discovered that pam_systemd does not properly sanitize the environment before using the XDG_SEAT variable. It is possible for an attacker, in some particular configurations, to set a XDG_SEAT environment variable which allows for commands to be checked against polkit policies using the "allow_active" element rather than "allow_any".

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gudev-1.0 - 204-5ubuntu20.31
libgudev-1.0-0 - 204-5ubuntu20.31
No subscription required

libpam-systemd - 204-5ubuntu20.31
libsystemd-daemon0 - 204-5ubuntu20.31
libsystemd-id128-0 - 204-5ubuntu20.31
libsystemd-journal0 - 204-5ubuntu20.31
libsystemd-login0 - 204-5ubuntu20.31
libudev1 - 204-5ubuntu20.31
python-systemd - 204-5ubuntu20.31
systemd - 204-5ubuntu20.31
systemd-services - 204-5ubuntu20.31
udev - 204-5ubuntu20.31
No subscription required
